author: gwintery
content:
Hi all just a curious question. I remembered that one of the reason for EIP 1559 being considered is due to the tx fee rewards being higher than the block reward by a huge margin, encouraging selfish mining attack vectors.

Does this present a similar risk for validators? As I assume the lower issuance for validators will mean that current miner tip might exceed the normal staking rewards.

author: barnabemonnot
content:
in a sense the risk may still be there but the dynamics of reorgs should be vastly different in a PoS environment, see for instance https://www.paradigm.xyz/2021/07/ethereum-reorgs-after-the-merge/

it's not as easy as "renting enough hashpower" to overtake the PoW tip (putting in quotes because that's not necessarily super easy either, depending on the chain)

author: gwintery
content: Thanks i will give it a read!
